p: Among the effective medicinal plants are Olea europaea, Ficus carcia, and Salvadora persica. Olea europaea (O. europaea) is cultivated on a large scale in the Arabian Peninsula, India, and Asia, but the Mediterranean region is the main area of agricultural production [ 14, 15]. Recently, studies concerned with the medicinal properties of olive products have been focusing on olive polyphenols that have shown in animal and in vitro studies an antioxidant and an antimicrobial property [ 15].
